result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Edward Young Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay all costs, assessments and surcharges and provide proof of payment on that date as well as verification of completion of Sojourner Truth House BIP by 02/01/16. Failure to pay financial obligations will result in civil judgment.
*Courts no contact with victim to continue.

*The court will impose 30 days HOC and Stay that until a review date of 02/01/16 at 8:15.

**02-26-16, Court stays the 30 day jail sentence permanently**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Edward Young Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for review hearing that was originally scheduled for 3/1/2016. Defendant has provided the court with proof of payment as well as verification of completion of Sojourner Truth House. Court stays the 30 day day jail sentence permanently.

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant needs to provide written proof of completion of community service hours.  Court orders case adjourned for another review hearing in Branch 45.  Review hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 40.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
The court will impose 30 days House of Correction and STAY that until a review date of 2-1-2016 at 8:15.
The court orders defendant to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges and provide proof of payment on that date as well as verification of completion of Sojourner Truth House BIP by 2-1-2016.  Failure to pay financial obligations will result in civil judgment.
Courts no contact with victim to continue.
CR-233 filed.  Review hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing memo from the defense received and filed.  rmm

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in bRANCH 40. Branch  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will allow the 911 call.  As Court has an felony trial ready to go, this matter is adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Admission of 911 Recording received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Michal Schwab, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State would like use the 911 call.  Defense objects.  Court ordered matter adjourned and the parties are to brief the issue.  State to file motion with the Court by 6/22/15; defense to file response by 7/13/15.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 06/08/2015 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mohagany C

Defendant Mark Edward Young in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Mark Edward Young in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
